storyInfo: When life settles down, Reed finally gets a chance to learn about the Sankta who made the ultimate sacrifice to save her.

attributes.content: Smoke and debris spill over the hills, scorching flames searing the land.
The helpless red dragon, locked upon its throne.
Threads pierce its bones – so that it may not move.
Originium splits open its flesh – so that it may not heal.
Cries fill its ears – so that it may find no rest.
A scepter nails the tip of its tongue, a crown binds its brain, and a stone orb crushes its spine.
It is a red dragon atop a throne, a puppet of the shadows.
It may not resist, beg for mercy, or escape.
Within its purgatory, the living statue weeps.
Tears drip from its eyes, flowing along the threads into its unhealing scars.
All it receives in return for its suffering and obedience is silence.
Bitter hail begins to fall from the sky—
Dublinn's men might come back any moment now. We need to find a way to get another car.
Don't worry, I promise you we're going to make it out of here alive.
Was she caught up in a Catastrophe? Both her Originium infection as well as her wounds are quite severe...
*sigh*... Once we've done our part, the rest is up to her.
Then, we'll register your information.
Out of consideration for the fact that you're still a patient, we've prepared a single dorm for you. If that's acceptable, then please sign here.
Reed sits down on the bed, blankly staring at the door to her room.
Rhodes Island's standard-issue sliding door perfectly fulfills the task for which it was created, letting not even a speck of light through.
Of course, its sound insulation is also beyond question. Though, given that it is that time of day when people begin their daily activities, some noisy voices nevertheless reach Reed's ears.
This is exactly the life she dreamed of.
She need only open the door, and she would become a part of Rhodes Island too, living a life in the sunlight.
However—
Ugh... It hurts...
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: The Originium crystals remind her—
The feeling of guilt reminds her—
The shadows remind her—
She doesn't deserve it.
'For Dublinn!' No matter how guilty she felt, she had put so, so many people to death with this rallying cry.
Every one of those souls, young and old, were always staring at her. It's all they can do now, harshly sting at her soul whenever her heart sways like a reed in the wind.
That's the only form of revenge left for the dead.
Repent, and you will be forgiven – a cheap adage for the heartless. True forgiveness does not exist.
After all, the dead cannot speak, nor can they forgive. All they can do is torment.
Just as they were tormented.
This... is how it should be...
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: This is what I deserve...
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Reed lies down again, with her back to the door, as if this would somehow let her ignore the noises coming from beyond.
Those things don't belong to her. She isn't worthy.
No matter how badly she wants them.
I belong in a prison...
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: However, within this darkness...
She still remembers the light that occasionally pierced the dark clouds.
Born from a ring of flame... like a sun...
She longs to touch that light...
Reed, are you in there?
One moment... I'll be right there...
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Hello, I'm here to give you your routine physical.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: Didn't the Doctor say...
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Oh, yes— The two of you agreed that you should be undergoing regular comprehensive examinations, right? But what we're doing now is just the most basic stuff—blood pressure and heart rate monitoring. No needles or clunky equipment involved.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: You're still an inpatient for now, and we do need to keep tabs on your numbers, but the Doctor won't always be available. I won't bother you again until your condition has stabilized.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: Of course, if you don't want to, I'm not going to force you.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: I appreciate the help... Come on in.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Go ahead and lie back down on the bed.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: Mhm...
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: The light switch... should be right here... Found it.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: Ugh...
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Oh, sorry about that! I'll dim it down a bit—
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: N-No worries. This is good enough...
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: O-Okay then.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: Then, let me have you flat on the bed, and I'll handle the rest.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: Mhm...
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Before lying down, Reed moves her tail to the other side of the bed so that the burning flames will not affect the work of the Medical operator.
The fabrics of the bed are made from special materials so she doesn't have to worry about inadvertently setting the entire room on fire.
Reed originally thought the medic would stare at her tail curiously and ask questions, but she simply stares at the notebook and her instruments, with no intention of making small talk.
So Reed lies face-up on the bed, casting her eyes towards the ceiling, her gaze slowly drawn to the light emanating from the ceiling lamp.
That should do the trick... Next up is...
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: It is nothing more than an ordinary ceiling light. Upon closer inspection, she can see a ring-shaped bulb through the covering.
Like a Sankta's shining halo...
Do you know... where the Sankta who saved me is? I want to thank her...
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: You were sent to Rhodes Island by a Victorian Vouivre and some Rhodes Island operators who were on a mission in County Hillock. I don't recall any Sankta being among them.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: Did I misremember...?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Reed continues to look at the ceiling lamp. The light from that Sankta was so vivid in her memory, there should be no mistaking it.
But I did hear that we lost an elite operator during that operation...
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: Elite operator...?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: She was a respected older woman. Though she rarely swung by Medical, the snipers who came by for treatment or just to get a physical always had something to say about her.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: They said that she was extremely patient, and that her revolver was even more accurate.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: If I recall, I think she was a Sankta...
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: What... was her name?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Outcast... That's what they all called her...
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: Outcast...
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: The conversation seemingly reaches a dead end as the two tacitly agree to stop talking. Only the occasional beeps from the medical equipment still echo across the room.
Alright, all done with the exam. Congratulations, Reed, a lot of your indicators have improved since your last exam, which means your condition should be stabilizing soon.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: Mhm...
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Then, if there's nothing else you need, I'll be heading out.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: Should I turn the lights off?
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: No thanks, this is fine...
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Alright. I'll leave you to it, then.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: Her death...
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Was my fault...
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Reed's mind starts to go blank.
She had never interacted with this Outcast person before – as a matter of fact, she only learned of her code name just now.
And yet, she had made the ultimate sacrifice to save her life?
Outcast... Outcast...
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: She repeats this name again and again, the name of the person who peeled back the corners of darkness for her.
Whether it was out of honor, respect, or simply curiosity, she feels as if it is her duty to know more about this great individual.
Of course, once she's fulfilled this duty, she would once again have to return to her room to continue her self-imposed confinement.
Daily life suddenly blossoms so vividly before her, and it proves strange and foreign.
Some cordial pleasantries, a bit of noise stirred up by trivial matters, and some idle chatter to pass the time.
How long had it been since she experienced these things?
Reed holds onto her left wrist with her right hand and leans against the edge of the corridor, trying to hide her tail as best as possible to make herself less conspicuous.
How she craves to be a part of this life; to pick up a fountain pen, or to savor a soft drink.
But she is not allowed to.
The ghosts of the past still sit atop her shoulders, tearing away any hopes she might have for a better life.
Hello...
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Hm? Oh, Reed, please have a seat.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: How can I help you today?
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: I want to ask something... about Outcast...
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Oh... Did you have some business with her?
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: Her office isn't too far from here. After all, the personnel transfer happened only a few months ago.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: I have a map here. You can take a look if you want.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: Basically... Go this way, and you'll be there after turning the corner.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: Thank you...
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: No worries. Just doing my job.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: (*whispers*) Hasn't Outcast's office already been...
attributes.name: Operator Passerby

attributes.content: (*whispers*) Hush. Just mind your own business.
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: (*whispers*) Do you think I don't know? Can't you just leave someone to their thoughts?
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: Oh, y-yeah...
attributes.name: Operator Passerby

attributes.content: *sigh*... What a pitiful sight...
attributes.name: Human Resources Operator

attributes.content: This should be the place.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Hello. Can I help you?
attributes.name: Records Room Operator

attributes.content: Excuse me, is this where Outcast's office is?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Oh...
attributes.name: Records Room Operator

attributes.content: Yes, this used to be her office.
attributes.name: Records Room Operator

attributes.content: It was transferred to us recently, and we're about to turn it into a new archive.
attributes.name: Records Room Operator

attributes.content: Are you her...?
attributes.name: Records Room Operator

attributes.content: Oh, it's nothing... I was just taking a look around...
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Suit yourself– Wait, I see. I get it now.
attributes.name: Records Room Operator

attributes.content: Please, go right ahead.
attributes.name: Records Room Operator

attributes.content: Outcast... Did she leave anything behind here?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Sorry, but the HR Department has probably already disposed of her personal effects.
attributes.name: Records Room Operator

attributes.content: Oh, okay...
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: She thought she'd be able to find some trace of Outcast's existence here, but instead all she finds is an empty office and a complete stranger.
So she begins to think about where else on Rhodes Island this Sankta may have had ties.
Sankta... Guns... Sniper operators...
May I ask you one more question?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Go ahead.
attributes.name: Records Room Operator

attributes.content: Where can I find the shooting range?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Reed heads to the shooting range, hoping to find some information on Outcast. Anything would do; surely there would be someone here who knows her.
But upon entering the vast facility, the only thing she feels... is fear.
The unfortunate are tied up to the target dummies while the brainwashed raise their weapons towards them, awaiting her command.
No... This isn't how it should be...
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: No matter what she wants to say, no matter what she says, her every word is a command. With each word, a trigger is pulled, and a bolt rips its way into flesh.
The operators are here to train, and so the cycle continues – reload, aim, shoot.
The targets are here to be destroyed, and so the cycle continues – wait, be aimed at, confirm hit.
The victims are bound tightly to the target dummies, lamenting Reed's savagery until their lifeblood runs dry.
And so, this place ceases to be a training ground, and instead becomes an exhibition of her vile deeds.
No, no...
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Look out!
You alright, mate?
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: Mm... Thank you.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Station 6, as well as stations 5, 4, 7, and 8 will be temporarily closed for maintenance for fifteen minutes. Any operators using those stations, please come on down.
attributes.name: Training Ground Manager

attributes.content: And you, the bastard in station number 6, don't even think of running off! I'll be seeing you in the administrative office!
attributes.name: Training Ground Manager

attributes.content: The fella who brought explosives to the shooting range is probably in for a real tongue-lashing.
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: Oh, hey there, Adnachiel~
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: Oh, Kroos, did you make a new friend?
attributes.name: Adnachiel

attributes.content: Nah, we just met. I think she dropped by the shooting range to get a feel for what it's like over here?
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: See, look at the super long lance she's holding. Not much of a sniper, if you ask me.
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: Hello, my name is Adnachiel.
attributes.name: Adnachiel

attributes.content: Whoops, looks like I forgot to introduce myself— 'ello there, the name's Kroos.
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: Reed... You can just call me Reed...
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Um...
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: Oh yeah, Adnachiel, you ready for the upcoming practical?
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Adnachiel

attributes.content: Oh. With Melantha leading us, there won't be any issues.
attributes.name: Adnachiel

attributes.content: Hmm~? But I've been seeing you in the training stations practicing with your handgun~
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: Haha, caught red-handed, huh?
attributes.name: Adnachiel

attributes.content: (Gun... Sankta...)
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Sure, I haven't gotten authorization to use a gun yet, but as someone from Laterano, how could I not want to try it out?
attributes.name: Adnachiel

attributes.content: Which is why I asked Outcast to give me some training earlier.
attributes.name: Adnachiel

attributes.content: Like, Blacksteel-style?
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: Yup.
attributes.name: Adnachiel

attributes.content: She taught me a whole bunch of gunnery tips, like the influence of how I hold my gun on my reaction speed, or how to quickly draw and fire.
attributes.name: Adnachiel

attributes.content: In one demonstration, she even specifically showed how to execute it with both a gun and a crossbow, teaching me that certain techniques are actually transferrable.
attributes.name: Adnachiel

attributes.content: Then you'll have to give me a rundown sometime. Can never have too many tricks up your sleeve~
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: Sure, sounds like a plan.
attributes.name: Adnachiel

attributes.content: But...
attributes.name: Adnachiel

attributes.content: We agreed to do a progress check on my skills before continuing, but...
attributes.name: Adnachiel

attributes.content: (Outcast...)
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: What is it like... to shoot a gun?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: What is it like? Uh... I'm not sure I really understand either.
attributes.name: Adnachiel

attributes.content: Alright, take down those barriers and warning signs.
attributes.name: Training Ground Manager

attributes.content: The five training stations are open again. Get back to practice, you guys.
attributes.name: Training Ground Manager

attributes.content: You'll get a feel for it when you try it yourself, Reed.
attributes.name: Adnachiel

attributes.content: I... will...?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Is it really okay?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Training handguns are made specifically for novices. Like crossbows, they're not that hard to use.
attributes.name: Adnachiel

attributes.content: And we'll be here with you, so you got nothing to worry about~
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: I understand.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Just pay attention to how I'm handling it.
attributes.name: Adnachiel

attributes.content: Is this... how you do it?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Yup, you've got your fingers in the right places.
attributes.name: Adnachiel

attributes.content: Now, lift the gun, aim the crosshair at the target, and pull the trigger~
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: Aim at the target...
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: She clutches the gun tightly.
The training gun is fairly light, but it keeps trembling in her hands.
Don't be nervous now. Just take a deep breath~
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: Mhm...
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: She aims at her scars, at her ghosts, at this display of her sins.
And pulls the trigger—
Nice shot~ Though, just a bit off the mark.
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: Reed's shot completely missed the mark, only leaving a black dot in the upper-left corner of the target paper.
Thank you...
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Reed sets the gun down.
Not gonna give it another try?
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: I think that's enough...
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: The moment she fired the bullet, the gun responded with a powerful recoil.
It was a Sankta weapon. To squeeze the trigger is to make a declaration. And at the same time, to accept the consequences.
Outcast was fully aware of how heavy each shot she fired was, yet she... most likely never hesitated.
I'll continue with my training then.
attributes.name: Adnachiel

attributes.content: After the test is over, I should probably make a trip to the reliquary and report the results to the instructor.
attributes.name: Adnachiel

attributes.content: Reliquary?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Yup, the reliquary.
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: It's a place where Rhodes Island stores the belongings of excellent instructors that've since left us.
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: Where is this... reliquary?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Reliquary Entrance

After entering the Integrated Bioprocessing Unit, continue around the corner and you'll reach the door to the reliquary. Perhaps the lengthy corridor leading up to it is in consideration of the special nature of the room.
Reed planned to head straight inside, but a conversation between two operators in the corner catches her attention.
Because of a name they brought up–
(Outcast...)
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: The two operators seem to have been members of her team.
So she also takes a spot in the corner, as if waiting for someone.
She wants to hear what they have to say about Outcast.
So do you regret it now? Not going with her?
attributes.name: Calm Operator

attributes.content: I already saw the report. What happened at County Hillock spun completely out of control.
attributes.name: Calm Operator

attributes.content: Even so, she could have easily made it back alive, if she really wanted to.
attributes.name: Pensive Operator

attributes.content: This is Outcast we're talking about.
attributes.name: Pensive Operator

attributes.content: ...Misery brought her gun chamber back. At the very end, she fired all six rounds.
attributes.name: Calm Operator

attributes.content: Do you think she had any regrets?
attributes.name: Calm Operator

attributes.content: Reed holds her breath.
Never.
attributes.name: Pensive Operator

attributes.content: So, I'll bring the question back around. What about you?
attributes.name: Calm Operator

attributes.content: Reed looks away. She can almost envision what is about to be said.
Anger, hatred. These things are all too familiar to her.
I don't regret a thing either.
attributes.name: Pensive Operator

attributes.content: (Huh?)
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: She's never hesitated to ask for our help before. Since she decided to go solo this time, I'm sure she'd already thought things through.
attributes.name: Pensive Operator

attributes.content: The evacuees from County Hillock brought back someone seriously wounded.
attributes.name: Calm Operator

attributes.content: An Infected?
attributes.name: Pensive Operator

attributes.content: An Infected.
attributes.name: Calm Operator

attributes.content: If there's any outcome that would satisfy her, that'd be it.
attributes.name: Pensive Operator

attributes.content: Then, let's not disturb her rest any longer. She's been so busy for so long, she really ought to get some sleep.
attributes.name: Pensive Operator

attributes.content: Goodnight, our dear old friend. May you still remember a few of us in your dreams.
attributes.name: Calm Operator

attributes.content: We'll come see you again next time.
attributes.name: Calm Operator

attributes.content: Her life being saved must have been a coincidence.
But one thing is for certain.
As long as she meets Outcast, she will find salvation.
No matter how much the situation changes, the outcome remains the same.
Reed looks down the corridor to the entrance of the reliquary.
There, Outcast is awaiting her arrival.
Originally, these artifacts were stacked in a warehouse in the Integrated Bioprocessing Unit, along with other unclaimed items.
But everyone knows that some things will never be claimed, and only gather dust in the warehouse. Precious artifacts, fated to be eroded by time.
So they were placed into custom-made storage containers, and housed in a small room at the end of the warehouse.
It is a cemetery, made for the operators who have given their lives for the cause.
But there are neither flowers nor tombstones here.
Everyone keeps their voices down, for fear of disturbing the slumber of the deceased.
The same goes for Reed. She restrains her fire, trying not to allow the dancing flames to disturb the solemn atmosphere.
In front of each artifact compartment is a plume of light, and Reed follows the lights to identify the person sleeping there.
Scout......Whitesmith......
Outcast.
Her artifacts are here.
Just as Reed approaches, someone else happens to be turning around to leave.
(Quietly) Doctor...
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Here, silence is the most effective means of communication.
After a simple exchange of courtesies, the two pass each other by.
It is then that Reed sees the code name of the one the Doctor was mourning–
Ace.
Perhaps, it tells the story of another savior. Perhaps one day, someone will tell that story to her.
But not today.
She walks in front of Outcast's artifact compartment, bows slightly, then reflects upon the legacy she left behind on this land.
In the compartment lies a damaged gun chamber, and next to it lies a eulogy someone wrote for her–

('She never capitulated, even after enduring countless trials and tribulations. Her muzzle belched tongues of flame that burned like an angry sun, and the glow above her head was brighter than the daylight itself.')
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: ('Buried here is Outcast, our friend.')
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: *sniffle*...
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: (Hello, Outcast.)
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: (I've come here to thank you. Thank you for giving me a chance.)
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: (My name is... Reed. The reason I came here... is to find answers.)
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: (I want to know... what kind of person saved my life.)
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: (Now, I understand.)
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: (I always doubted whether you saving me served any purpose.)
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: (I was mistaken. In your eyes, all life is equally precious.)
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: (Thank you...)
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: (I was once my sister's puppet, and did so many unspeakable things. I once thought this land held nothing but darkness.)
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: (But now, you've showed me, taught me that light still shines upon this land.)
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: (Not the fires of disaster, but something... warmer, more brilliant...)
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: (Should I become a light like you? Am I even able to?)
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: The light shining on Outcast's artifact compartment also casts its rays upon Reed, drawing a shadow behind her that blends into the environment.
(I am... a weak person. I can't stand up to my sister, let alone put my life on the line to realize my ideals like you...)
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: (But even so... I will try... This is the only way I have to repay you...)
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: (I still need more time... I need to understand what I must do to be worthy of you, to be worthy of this life you saved.)
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: (The firelight always casts a shadow... But this time, I want to try letting it bring life and hope.)
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: (...Goodbye, Outcast.)
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Reed turns around, and walks from the glowing light into the darkness.
The path leading out of the room is long and dark, swallowing her up entirely, leaving nothing but the flame at the tip of her tail.
But her flame remains steady and unyielding, radiating light and warmth, steadfastly and persistently drifting towards the exit.
At that moment, for the first time in its life, the scarred red dragon roars.
And a glimmer of light flashes across a withered, dusky hillock.
